Melbourne bot Garden

In reply to your minute of yesterday
M is responding to a minute by the Under Secretary, W. H. Odgers, 'for Dr. von Mueller's attention. 19 April 1871', on a letter written on 24 Febraury 1871 to the Government of Victoria by C. Girdlestone, Officiating Junior Under Secretary to the Government of India, acknowledging the receipt of a box of seeds sent in January, adding: 'the bags in which the seeds have been packed do not bear any description of seeds they contain. I am to request that this omission may be rectified when the remainder of the promised seeds is sent.' [Y71/4276 fill in details ]. (received this day) I have the honor of transmitting a copy of my letter, which accompanied the box of seeds, prepared for transmission to the Government of India by the mail early in January (vide annex A, dated 29/12/70).
See M to J. McCulloch, 29 December 1870 (in this edition as 70-12-29a). A copy of that letter is attached to the present letter. That consignment contained only two sorts of seeds, vize 30 lb Eucalyptus Sideroxylon and 15 lb Eucalyptus amygdalina, so that not the slightest doubt about the kinds could arise. It was arranged at my Office, that a label with the name of each kind of seed should be placed inside each bag, and if this is is
repeated?
not done, it is an accidental omission, for which I express my regret. In weighing the bags the kinds of seeds might at once be ascertained.

Annex B
See M to J. McCulloch, 20 January 1871. A copy of that letter is attached to the present letter. is the copy of a letter, which accompanied the second sending of Eucalyptus fissilis (15 lb) prepared for the mail of end of January.
